title: CCF node configuration
description: JSON schema for configuration of a single CCF node

bind_address.description: Local address the node binds to and listens on

published_address.description: The published node address advertised to other nodes. This must be different on each node

node_to_node_interface.description: Addresses (host:port) to listen on for incoming node-to-node connections (e.g. internal consensus messages)

bind_address.description: Local address the node binds to and listens on

published_address.description: The published RPC address advertised to clients

app_protocol.description: The application protocol used by all sessions on this interface

max_open_sessions_soft.description: The maximum number of active client sessions on that interface after which clients will receive an HTTP 503 error

max_open_sessions_hard.description: The maximum number of active client sessions on that interface after which clients sessions will be terminated, before the TLS handshake is complete. Note that its value must be greater than the value of ``max_open_sessions_soft``

max_body_size.description: Maximum size (size string) of a single HTTP request body. Submitting a request with a payload larger than this value will result in the client session being automatically closed

max_header_size.description: Maximum size (size string) of a single HTTP request header (key or value). Submitting a request with a header larger than this value will result in the client session being automatically closed

max_headers_count.description: Maximum number of headers in a single HTTP request. Submitting a request with more headers than this value will result in the session being automatically closed

max_concurrent_streams_count.description: HTTP/2 only. Maximum number of concurrent streams allowed per session

initial_window_size.description: HTTP/2 only. Initial size (size string) of flow-control window per stream

max_frame_size.description: HTTP/2 only. Maximum allowed size (size string) of HTTP/2 frames (min: 16KB, max: 16MB)

authority.description: The type of endorsement for the TLS certificate used in client sessions. If the endorsement is not available, client sessions will be terminated, before the TLS handshake is complete. 'Node' means self-signed, 'Service' means service-endorsed, 'ACME' is deprecated, 'Unsecured' means unencrypted traffic and no endorsement authority

accepted_endpoints.description: An array of regular expressions that specify which URL paths are served on the interface. Optional; if not present, all paths are served

forwarding_timeout_ms.description: Timeout for forwarded RPC calls (in milliseconds)

redirections.description: Configure how redirect responses should be produced on this interface. If this is omitted, then forwarding will be used instead

to_primary.description: Configures how the Location header should be populated, when requests arrive on this interface that must be served by a primary while the receiving node is not a primary

to_backup.description: Configures how the Location header should be populated, when requests arrive on this interface that must be served by a backup while the receiving node is currently a primary

enabled_operator_features.description: An array of features which should be enabled on this interface, providing access to endpoints with specific security or performance constraints.

rpc_interfaces.description: Interfaces to listen on for incoming client TLS connections, as a dictionary from unique interface name to RPC interface information

network.description: This section includes configuration for the interfaces a node listens on (for both client and node-to-node communications)

service_certificate_file.description: For ``Start`` and ``Recover`` nodes, path to which service certificate will be written to on startup. For ``Join`` nodes, path to the certificate of the existing service to join

constitution_files.description: List of constitution files. These typically include actions.js, validate.js, resolve.js and apply.js

initial_service_certificate_validity_day.description: Initial validity period (days) for service certificate

service_subject_name.description: Subject name to include in service certificate. Can only be set once on service start.

issuer.description: Issuer, set in CWT_Claims of COSE ledger signatures. Can only be set once on service start.

subject.description: Subject, set in CWT_Claims of COSE ledger signatures. Can only be set once on service start.

certificate_file.description: Path to member x509 identity certificate (PEM)

encryption_public_key_file.description: Path to member encryption public key (PEM)

recovery_role.description: Whether the member acts as a recovery participant and gets assigned a share that can contribute towards a recovery threshold or as an owner and gets assigned a full recovery key

members.description: List of initial consortium members files, including identity certificates, public encryption keys and member data files

recovery_threshold.description: Number of recovery members required to recover the service. Note that if the recovery threshold is set to 0, it is automatically set to the number of recovery members specified in 'members'

maximum_node_certificate_validity_days.description: The maximum number of days allowed for node certificate validity period

maximum_service_certificate_validity_day.description: The maximum number of days allowed for service certificate validity period

recent_cose_proposals_window_size.description: Size of the window of COSE proposals recently received by the service, kept for the purpose of replay protection

target_rpc_address.description: Address (host:port) of a node of the existing service to join

retry_timeout.description: Interval (time string) at which the node sends join requests to the existing service. This should be less than the value of 'consensus.election_timeout' set on the primary node of the existing service to join

follow_redirect.description: Whether to follow redirects to the primary node of the existing service to join

fetch_recent_snapshot.description: Whether to ask the target for a snapshot before joining. The node will ask the target what their latest snapshot is, and will fetch it via RPC before launching. Should generally only be turned off for specific test cases

fetch_snapshot_max_attempts.description: Maximum number of attempts to fetch a recent snapshot from the target node

fetch_snapshot_retry_interval.description: Interval (time string) between retries to fetch a recent snapshot from the target node

fetch_snapshot_max_size.description: Maximum size of snapshot this node is willing to fetch

initial_service_certificate_validity_day.description: Initial validity period (days) for service certificate

previous_service_identity_file.description: Path to the previous service certificate (PEM) file

previous_sealed_ledger_secret_location.description: Path to the sealed ledger secret folder, the ledger secrets for the recovered service will be unsealed from here instead of reconstructed from recovery shares.

intrinsic_id.description: Intrinsic identifier of this node, used to identify it in the self-healing-open protocol

published_address.description: Published address (host:port) of this node, used to identify it in the self-healing-open protocol

intrinsic_id.description: Intrinsic identifier of the node, used to identify it in the self-healing-open protocol

published_address.description: Published address (host:port) of the node, used for communication during the self-healing-open protocol

cluster_identities.description: List of identities for all nodes in the cluster

retry_timeout.description: Interval (time string) at which the node re-sends self-healing-open messages. This should be significantly less than 'failover_timeout'

failover_timeout.description: Interval (time string) after which the node forcibly advances to the next phase of the self-healing-open protocol

command.description: This section includes configuration of how the node should start (either start, join or recover) and associated information

subject_name.description: Subject name to include in node certificate

subject_alt_names.description: List of ``iPAddress:`` or ``dNSName:`` strings to include as Subject Alternative Names (SAN) in node certificates. If none are set, the node certificate will automatically include the value of the main RPC interface 'published_address'

curve_id.description: Elliptic curve to use for node identity key

initial_validity_days.description: Initial validity period (days) for node certificate

node_certificate.description: This section includes configuration for the node x509 identity certificate

node_data_json_file.description: Path to file (JSON) containing initial node data. It is intended to store correlation IDs describing the node's deployment, such as a VM name or Pod identifier

snp_security_policy_file.description: Path to file containing the security policy (SEV-SNP only), can contain environment variables, such as $UVM_SECURITY_CONTEXT_DIR

snp_uvm_endorsements_file.description: Path to file containing UVM endorsements as a base64-encoded COSE Sign1 (SEV-SNP only). Can contain environment variables, such as $UVM_SECURITY_CONTEXT_DIR

snp_endorsements_file.description: Path to file containing AMD VCEK hardware endorsements (a PEM certificate chain), base-64 encoded. Can contain environment variables, such as $UVM_SECURITY_CONTEXT_DIR. Will be used in preference to snp_endorsements_servers if the tcbm in this file matches that of the attestation

type.description: Type of server used to retrieve attestation report endorsement certificates (SEV-SNP only)

url.description: Server URLs used to retrieve attestation report endorsement certificates, e.g. "kdsintf.amd.com" (AMD), "global.acccache.azure.net" (Azure) or "169.254.169.254" (THIM)

max_retries_count.description: Maximum number of retries to fetch endorsements from the server

snp_endorsements_servers.description: List of servers used to retrieve attestation report endorsement certificates (SEV-SNP only). The first server in the list is always used and other servers are only specified as fallback. If set, attestation endorsements from ``--snp-security-context-dir-var`` are ignored, but uvm endorsements from that directory are still used.

attestation.description: This section includes configuration for the attestation for AMD SEV-SNP platform.

service_data_json_file.description: Path to file (JSON) containing initial service data. It is used when the node starts in 'Start' or 'Recover' mode and is intended to store arbitrary information about the service

read_only_directories.description: Paths to read-only ledger directories. Note that only '.committed' files will be read from these directories

chunk_size.description: Minimum size (size string) of the current ledger file after which a new ledger file (chunk) is created

ledger.description: This section includes configuration for the ledger directories and files

tx_count.description: Number of transactions after which a snapshot is automatically generated

snapshots.description: This section includes configuration for the snapshot directories and files

host_level.description: Logging level for the untrusted host. DEPRECATED, use the --log-level CLI switch instead.

format.description: If 'json', node logs will be formatted as JSON

logging.description: This section includes configuration for the logging of the node process

message_timeout.description: Maximum interval (time string) at which the primary node sends messages to backup nodes to maintain its primary-ship. This should be set to a significantly lower value than 'election_timeout'

election_timeout.description: Maximum timeout (time string) after which backup nodes that have not received any message from the primary node (or voted for a candidate) will trigger a new election. This timeout is also used by candidates to restart unsuccessful elections. This should be set to a significantly greater value than 'message_timeout' plus the expected network delay

max_uncommitted_tx_count.description: Maximum number of uncommitted transactions allowed before the primary refuses new transactions. Unlimited if set to 0.

consensus.description: This section includes configuration for the consensus protocol (note: should be the same for all other nodes in the service)

tx_count.description: Number of transactions after which a signature transaction is automatically generated

delay.description: Maximum duration after which a signature transaction is automatically generated

ledger_signatures.description: This section includes configuration for the ledger signatures emitted by this node (note: should be the same for all other nodes in the service). Transaction commit latency in a CCF network is primarily a function of signature frequency. A network emitting signatures more frequently will be able to commit transactions faster, but will spend a larger proportion of its execution resources creating and verifying signatures. Setting signature frequency is a trade-off between transaction latency and throughput

key_refresh_interval.description: Interval at which JWT keys for issuers registered with auto-refresh are automatically refreshed

jwt.description: This section includes configuration for JWT issuers automatic refresh

node_certificate_file.description: Path to self-signed node certificate output by node on startup

pid_file.description: Path to file in which process identifier (PID) will be written to on startup

node_to_node_address_file.description: Path to file in which node address (hostname and port) will be written to on startup. This option is particularly useful when binding to port 0 and getting auto-assigned a port by the OS. No file is created if this entry is not specified

rpc_addresses_file.description: Path to file in which all RPC addresses (hostnames and ports) will be written to on startup. This option is particularly useful when binding to port 0 and getting auto-assigned a port by the OS. No file is created if this entry is not specified

sealed_ledger_secret_location.description: Path to the folder where the node will seal its ledger secrets.

output_files.description: This section includes configuration for additional files output by the node

tick_interval.description: Interval at which the enclave time will be updated by the host (modify with care!)

slow_io_logging_threshold.description: Maximum duration of I/O operations (ledger and snapshots) after which slow operations will be logged to node log

node_client_interface.description: Address to bind to for node-to-node client connections. If unspecified, this is automatically assigned by the OS. This option is particularly useful for testing purposes (e.g. establishing network partitions between nodes)

client_connection_timeout.description: Maximum duration after which unestablished client connections will be marked as timed out and either re-established or discarded

idle_connection_timeout.description: Timeout for idle connections. Null is a valid option, and means idle connections are retained indefinitely

worker_threads.description: Experimental. Number of additional threads processing incoming client requests in the enclave (modify with care!)

circuit_size.description: Size (size string) of the internal host-enclave ringbuffers (must be a power of 2)

max_msg_size.description: Maximum size (size string) for a message sent over the ringbuffer. Messages may be split into multiple fragments, but this limits the total size of the sum of those fragments

max_fragment_size.description: Maximum size (size string) of individual ringbuffer message fragments. Messages larger than this will be split into multiple fragments

memory.description: This section includes configuration for the host-enclave ring-buffer memory (modify with care!)

ignore_first_sigterm.description: Ignore the first SIGTERM received by the process, but set "stop_notice" in /node/state

node_to_node_message_limit.description: Cap at which node-to-node message channels will be closed, and a new channel will be created. Can be used to limit use of single cryptographic key

historical_cache_soft_limit.description: Historical queries cache soft limit (as size string)
